intro: Aeollanthus pinnatifidus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Aeollanthus pinnatifidus is known for its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
